perturbation.original_text: The exclusive purpose of the Venture (the "Purpose") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service.
perturbation.changed_text: The primary goal of the Venture (the "Goal") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Purpose' and 'Goal' are used interchangeably but without a clear definition of how they relate. This introduces ambiguity as to whether the venture has one specific 'Purpose' or a broader set of 'Goals,' potentially affecting the scope of permissible activities and leading to disagreements. The term 'Purpose' is used later in section 36, while 'Goal' is never used again, generating confusion.

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Members has contributed to the assets of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Property Allocation"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'Capital Contribution' to 'Property Allocation' creates inconsistency. The contract defines 'Capital Contributions' later in section 59.a, so changing it to 'Property Allocation', causes conflict because 'Property Allocation' is never defined and this conflicts with the existing definition, impacting how contributions are valued and treated, and potentially impacting later dissolution valuations, specifically sections 38 and 39.

perturbation.original_text: On dissolution, the Venture will be liquidated promptly and within a reasonable time. 38. On the liquidation of the Venture assets, distribution of any amounts to Members will be made in proportion to their respective capital accounts or as otherwise may be agreed in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: On dissolution, the Venture will be dissolved promptly and within a reasonable time. 38. On the liquidation of the Venture assets, distribution of any amounts to Members will be made in proportion to their respective member balances or as otherwise may be agreed in writing.
perturbation.explanation: By swapping 'capital accounts' for 'member balances', there is potential for conflict. The text originally uses 'capital accounts', defined in section 21. The introduction of 'member balances' creates uncertainty, especially if a Member had debts, loans, or any other amount that is not the 'capital accounts'.
